2012 O

Project O
: O
Alert O
messaging O
is O
the O
process O
of O
reliably O
and O
securely O
circulating O
messages O
associated O

with O
an O
event O
to O
interested O
users O
. O
Due O
to O
the O
growth O
of O
Information O
Technology O
( O
IT O
) O
and O

telecommunications O
sectors O
in O
the O
recent O
past O
, O
the O
dissemination O
of O
alert O
messages O
has O
become O

prompt O
and O
easier O
. O

Since O
the O
existing O
business O
environment O
faces O
the O
challenge O
of O
reaching O
increasingly O
segmented O

markets O
, O
the O
design O
, O
delivery O
, O
and O
analysis O
of O
business O
communications O
needs O
to O
be O
tightly O

integrated O
across O
multiple O
alert O
notification O
channels O
. O
Telecommunication O
channels O
through O

which O
subscribers O
can O
receive O
alert O
messages O
may O
include O
email O
, O
fax O
, O
text O
messaging O
, O
instant O

messaging O
, O
broadband O
network O
and O
the O
like O
. O
Due O
to O
myriad O
software O
applications O
implemented O
by O

businesses O
and O
the O
vast O
demographics O
of O
customers O
, O
it O
may O
become O
necessary O
to O
segment O
alert O

messages O
so O
that O
the O
messages O
can O
be O
sent O
through O
channels O
based O
on O
business O
needs O
as O
well O

as O
customer O
preferences O
. O
Further O
, O
in O
order O
to O
maintain O
strong O
customer O
relationships O
, O
businesses O

need O
to O
time O
the O
messages O
precisely O
. O
This O
brief O
illustrates O
how O
Alert O
Notification O
System O
( O
IANS O
) O

can O
help O
organization O
leverage O
existing O
infrastructure O
to O
better O
service O
their O
customers O
. O

Achievements O
: O

Won O
a O
performance O
certificates O
and O
given O
a O
bonus O
for O
outstanding O
performance O

Received O
Onsite O
opportunity O
for O
supporting O
the O
production O
and O
DR O
environment O
at O
Saudi O
Arabia O

Responsibilities O
: O

Manual O
testing O
of O
the O
application O
, O

Description O
: O
Development O
of O
Basel O
II O
Application O
, O
Basel O
II O
is O
the O
second O
of O
the O
Basel O
Accords O
, O

which O
are O
recommendations O
on O
banking O
laws O
and O
regulations O
issued O
by O
the O
Basel O
Committee O
on O

Banking O
Supervision O
. O
The O
purpose O
of O
Basel O
II O
, O
which O
was O
initially O
published O
in O
June O
2004 O
, O
is O
to O

create O
an O
international O
standard O
that O
banking O
regulators O
can O
use O
when O
creating O
regulations O
about O

how O
much O
capital O
banks O
need O
to O
put O
aside O
to O
guard O
against O
the O
types O
of O
financial O
and O
operational O

risks O
banks O
face O
. O
In O
practice O
, O
Basel O
II O
attempts O
to O
accomplish O
this O
by O
setting O
up O
rigorous O
risk O

and O
capital O
management O
requirements O
designed O
to O
ensure O
that O
a O
bank O
holds O
capital O
reserves O

appropriate O
to O
the O
risk O
the O
bank O
exposes O
itself O
to O
through O
its O
lending O
and O
investment O
practices O
. O

The O
New O
Accord O
includes O
several O
methodologies O
for O
determining O
a O
bank O
's O
risk O
- O
based O
capital O

requirements O
for O
credit O
, O
market O
and O
operational O
risk O
. O
For O
Risk O
Based O
Capital O
( O
RBC O
) O
, O
Credit O
Usage O

( O
CU O
) O
and O
Stress O
Test O
( O
ST O
) O
, O
the O
methodologies O
that O
will O
be O
used O
for O
repo O
style O
transactions O
are O

Simple O
VaR O
if O
the O
collateral O
is O
eligible O
. O
If O
the O
collateral O
is O
ineligible O
then O
the O
Wholesale O
loan O

approach O
will O
be O
utilized O
or O
the O
collateral O
will O
be O
reduced O
to O
zero O
in O
the O
Simple O
VaR. O

. O

Roles O
and O
Responsibilities O
: O
Development O
, O
Testing O
and O
support O
. O

Used O
: O

9i O

LLU O

STP O
is O
basically O
a O
router O
that O
realys O
ss7 O
messages O
through O
various O
signally O
points O
. O
In O
project O
all O

STPs O
were O
replaced O
by O
ORACLE O
STP O
due O
to O
its O
advanced O
features O
, O
high O
end O
support O
, O
flexibility O
. O

The O
STP O
is O
connected O
to O
adjacent O
SEPs O
and O
STPs O
via O
signaling O
links O
. O
Based O
on O
the O
address O
fields O

of O
the O
SS7 O
messages O
, O
the O
STP O
routes O
the O
messages O
to O
the O
appropriate O
outgoing O
signaling O
link O
. O

: O

- O

Hornet O

DESCRIPTION O

IPv6 O
, O
formerly O
named O
IPng O
( O
next O
generation O
) O
, O
is O
the O
latest O
version O
of O
the O
Internet O
Protocol O
( O
IP O
) O
. O
IP O

is O
a O
packet O
- O
based O
protocol O
used O
to O
exchange O
data O
, O
voice O
, O
and O
video O
traffic O
over O
digital O
networks O

Cisco O
's O
Wide O
- O
Area O
Application O
Services O
IPv4 O
users O
can O
move O
to O
IPv6 O
and O
receive O
services O
such O

as O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
security O
, O
quality O
of O
service O
( O
QoS O
) O
, O
and O
globally O
unique O
addresses O
. O
The O
IPv6 O
address O

space O
reduces O
the O
need O
for O
private O
addresses O
and O
Network O
Address O
Translation O
( O
NAT O
) O
processing O

by O
border O
routers O
at O
network O
edges O
. O

Implementing O
basic O
IPv6 O
connectivity O
in O
the O
Cisco O
IOS O
software O
consists O
of O
assigning O
IPv6 O

addresses O
to O
individual O
router O
interfaces O
. O
The O
forwarding O
of O
IPv6 O
traffic O
can O
be O
enabled O
globally O
, O

and O
Cisco O
Express O
Forwarding O
switching O
for O
IPv6 O
can O
also O
be O
enabled O

The O
primary O
motivation O
for O
IPv6 O
is O
the O
need O
to O
meet O
the O
demand O
for O
globally O
unique O
IP O

addresses O
. O

to O

RELEASES O
LANCER O
, O
PHOENIX O
, O

DESCRIPTION O

Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
( O
WAAS O
) O
is O
a O
Cisco Companies_worked_at
Systems Companies_worked_at
technology O
that O
improves O
the O

performance O
of O
applications O
on O
a O
wide O
area O
network O
( O
WAN O
) O
. O
WAAS O
combines O
Cisco O
's O
Wide O
Area O

File O
Services O
( O
WAFS O
- O
products O
allow O
remote O
office O
users O
to O
access O
and O
share O
files O
globally O
at O

LAN O
speeds O
over O
the O
WAN O
) O
with O
WAN O
optimization O
inside O
of O
a O
router O
, O
accelerating O
TCP O
- O
based O

applications O
on O
a O
given O
network O
. O

WAAS O
system O
consists O
of O
a O
set O
of O
devices O
called O
wide O
area O
application O
engines O
( O
WAEs O
) O
that O
work O

together O
to O
optimize O
TCP O
traffic O
over O
your O
network O
. O
When O
client O
and O
server O
applications O
attempt O

to O
communicate O
with O
each O
other O
, O
the O
network O
intercepts O
and O
redirects O
this O
traffic O
to O
the O
WAEs O
so O

that O
they O
can O
act O
on O
behalf O
of O
the O
client O
application O
and O
the O
destination O
server O
. O

The O
WAEs O
examine O
the O
traffic O
and O
use O
built O
- O
in O
application O
policies O
to O
determine O
whether O
to O

optimize O
the O
traffic O
or O
allow O
it O
to O
pass O
through O
your O
network O
un O
optimized O

Mainly O
involves O
optimizing O
the O
various O
Ao O
's O
like O
HTTP O
, O
SSL O
, O
HTTPS O
and O
functional O
wise O
platform O

check O
. O

PRODUCT O
WAAS(Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
) O

Report O

- O

of O

- O
coding O

Incident O
Management O
Solution O
report O

report O

. O
This O

tool O
. O

. O
This O

PROJECT O

- O
BOOMI O

Project O
Name O

factor O
integration O
with O
Sterling O

years O

Project O
Abstract O
: O

https://www.indeed.com/r/Yogi-Pesaru/2ed7aded59ecf425?isid=rex-download&ikw=download-top&co=IN O

The O
integration O
for O
Sterling O
is O
a O
two O
- O
way O
integration O
to O
support O
the O
investigation O
and O
confirm O

accuracy O
of O
background O
information O
provided O
by O
selected O
candidates O
who O
have O
received O
have O

passed O
phone O
screening O
& O
or O
accepted O
verbal O
offers O
of O
employment O
. O

Boomi O
is O
the O
middle O
ware O
between O
success O
factor O
and O
sterling O
systems O
. O

Boomi O
sender O
interface O
picks O
up O
the O
profiles O
from O
SF O
and O
send O
to O
sterling O
for O
background O

verification O
. O
After O
receiving O
request O
from O
boomi O
sterling O
will O
send O
synchronous O
response O
with O
an O

Oder O
number O
, O
which O
will O
be O
updated O
to O
SF O
synchronously O
. O
After O
some O
time O
boomi O
receiver O
process O

( O
listener O
process O
) O
receives O
the O
asynchronous O
results O
from O
sterling O
which O
are O
updated O
back O
to O
SF O
. O

and O
responsibilities O
: O

analysis O
. O

as O
per O
the O
requirement O
. O

development O
as O
per O
design O
. O

testing O
the O
applications O
. O

Case O

Featured O
on O

Synopsis O
: O

BCWeb O
is O
a O
Windows O
Azure O
ASP.NET O
Web O
Role O
application O
; O
authenticated O
against O
STS O
using O

Federation O
services O
that O
provide O
a O
set O
of O
Web O
forms O
that O
help O
capture O
price O
exception O
details O
, O

information O
on O
business O
case O
for O
doing O
discounts O
on O
price O
lists O
, O
and O
helps O
calculate O
percentage O

of O
discount O
. O
It O
uses O
the O
ASP.NET O
connector O
and O
custom O
Web O
services O
to O
pull O
real O
- O
time O
price O

information O
from O
SAP O
, O
and O
provides O
sales O
executives O
with O
a O
light O
front O
- O
end O
to O
SAP O
. O
BCWeb O
helps O

simulate O
pricing O
discounts O
, O
manage O
business O
rules O
, O
customize O
routing O
and O
approval O
workflows O
, O

and O
update O
the O
LOB O
data O
stored O
in O
SAP O
. O
One O

major O

of O
this O
system O
is O
to O
improve O

field O
productivity O
by O
simplifying O

process O
and O
removing O
training O
requirements O
for O
complex O

back O
- O
end O
systems O
, O
in O
this O
case O
SAP O
. O
BCWeb O
integrates O
different O
promotion O
types O
into O
a O
simplified O

Web O
- O
application O
. O
It O
also O

2007 O

and O
to O

2007 O
. O
Additional O

include O
: O

Reduce O

by O
having O
a O
business O
case O
documented O
for O
each O
promotion O
field O
. O

Obtain O
visibility O
decisions O
and O
understand O
who O
required O
a O

. O

Understand O

Project O

US O
EPG O
Forecast O
Workbook O
( O
FWB O
) O
application O
is O
designed O
to O
support O
the O
US O
Enterprise O
Partner O

Group O
( O
US O
EPG O
) O
in O
producing O
and O
maintaining O
the O
monthly O
US O
sales O
forecast O
. O
It O
is O
a O
transactional O

database O
combined O
with O
Microsoft O
Office O
Excel O
functionality O
that O
enables O
end O
users O
to O
interact O

with O
the O
USNAForecast O
database O
. O
Typically O
, O
an O
ATU O
manager O
will O
connect O
to O
the O
corporate O
network O

and O
download O
data O
from O
the O
forecast O
database O
, O
which O
creates O
an O
offline O
forecast O
workbook O
. O
This O

data O
can O
then O
be O
accessed O
offline O
, O
modelled O
, O
and O
changes O
to O
certain O
data O
fields O
are O
subsequently O

uploaded O
back O
to O
the O
forecast O
database O
through O
a O
CorpNet O
connection O
. O
These O
changes O
are O
then O

stored O
in O
the O
online O
database O
and O
subsequently O
loaded O
back O
into O
upstream O
systems O
. O

Project O
01 O
: O
DOPRA O

Description O
of O
the O
project O

DOPRA O
is O
the O
platform O
for O
telecom O
products O
. O
It O
is O
a O
proprietary O
platform O
and O
has O
company O
internal O

customers O
. O
It O
has O
main O
two O
planes O
, O
system O
management O
and O
system O
service O
planes O
and O
several O

sub O
modules O
. O

I O
have O
successfully O
worked O
on O
the O
following O
modules O
. O

Module O
- O
MML O
INI O
Parser O
Tool O

MML O
is O
Configuration O
Tool O
used O
in O
communication O
equipments O

This O
Configuration O
Tool O
has O
set O
of O
default O
and O
user O
defined O
commands O
. O
INI O
Parsing O
tool O
is O
a O
tool O

which O
accepts O
MML O
Commands O
in O
certain O
grammar O
and O
generates O
Resource O
file O
and O
Binary O
File O

respectively O
which O
will O
be O
read O
by O
server O
to O
resister O
the O
commands O
. O

Involved O
in O
the O
development O
, O
testing O
, O
verification O
of O
the O
module O
on O
windows O
. O

Module O
- O
Man O
Machine O
Language O

MML O
is O
a O
configuration O
tool O
widely O
used O
in O
communication O
equipments O
. O
It O
uses O
Client O
/ O
Server O

architecture O
. O
MML O
server O
communicates O
with O
both O
the O
client O
and O
the O
APP O
in O
the O
equipment O
. O

It O
receives O
MML O
commands O
inputted O
by O
users O
from O
the O
client O
and O
relays O
it O
to O
APP O
to O
process O

it O
. O
After O
acquiring O
the O
processing O
result O
, O
the O
server O
generates O
a O
MML O
report O
and O
sends O
it O
back O

to O
the O
client O
. O
It O
interacts O
with O
other O
system O
modules O
. O
Connection O
Management O
, O
Authorization O

Management O
, O
Command O
Process O
, O
Data O
Synchronization O
, O
Event O
Notification O
, O
Command O
Parsing O
, O

LOG O
/ O
ALARM O
Handling O
are O
some O
of O
the O
functions O
of O
MML O
Server O
. O

Involved O
in O
the O
development O
, O
defect O
fixing O
and O
verification O
of O
the O
module O
on O
windows O
, O
Linux O
and O

vxworks O
platforms O
Involved O
in O
several O
release O
activities O
. O

Module O
- O
Configuration O
Management O

Configuration O
Management O
Module O
is O
core O
module O
of O
System O
Management O
. O
Its O
main O
function O

is O
to O
define O
specifications O
for O
configuration O
management O
interface O
between O
the O
configuration O

tool O
layer O
and O
the O
application O
layer O
, O
and O
provide O
related O
configuration O
command O
communication O

mechanism O
. O
Any O
information O
that O
can O
be O
modified O
by O
the O
user O
/ O
application O
and O
that O
affects O
the O

functionality O
of O
the O
application O
can O
be O
regarded O
as O
configurable O
data O
. O
All O
configuration O
commands O

can O
be O
sent O
to O
Configuration O
Management O
Module O
using O
a O
common O
interface O
type O
. O

Configuration O
Data O
Management O
Module O
is O
a O
supplementary O
optional O
component O
that O
can O
be O

loaded O
to O
provide O
a O
persistent O
storage O
( O
& O
amp O
; O
retrieval O
) O
mechanism O
for O
applications O
' O
static O

configuration O
data O
. O

Involved O
in O
the O
defect O
fixing O
and O
feature O
enhancement O
of O
the O
module O
on O
windows O
, O
Linux O
and O

vxworks O
platforms O

. O

Module O
- O
TL1 O

Transaction O
Language O
1 O
( O
TL1 O
) O
is O
a O
widely O
used O
, O
" O
legacy O
" O
, O
management O
protocol O
in O

telecommunications O
. O
It O
is O
a O
cross O
- O
vendor O
, O
cross O
- O
technology O
man O
- O
machine O
language O
, O
and O
is O

widely O
used O
to O
manage O
Synchronous O
Optical O
Networks O
( O
SONET O
) O
. O
It O
is O
defined O
for O
operation O

system/ O
network O
element O
( O
machine O
- O
to O
- O
machine O
) O
interfaces O
. O
TL1 O
corresponds O
to O
the O
User O
System O

Language O
( O
USL O
) O
, O
which O
is O
the O
language O
for O
human O
- O
to O
machine O
interactions O
. O
It O
is O
used O
for O
managing O

network O
elements O
in O
a O
network O
. O
TL1 O
Module O
is O
an O
interface O
between O
an O
Application O
and O
Client O
. O

Client O
sends O
the O
TL1 O
Commands O
to O
perform O
some O
configuration O
operations O
in O
the O
Applications O
. O

TL1 O
module O
process O
the O
client O
text O
